intro: Cuatresia cuspidata, commonly known as the pointed cuatresia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
